result.execSummary:
The defendant Joseph Allen Nitchals was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Joseph Allen Nitchals is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Joseph Allen Nitchals was found guilty of Possess w/ Intent-Amphetamine(>3-10g) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1m)(e)2.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
If a Wisconsin State Prison sentence is imposed, outstanding financial obligations shall be paid from all inmate money at a rate of 25% and the balance due as a condition of extended supervision. 

In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.
Concurrent with: Case 2007CF166.

CO: RMW , REP: Melstrom, CLERK: Liddle ADA:   Erica Ellenwood   DF ATTY:  Jeremiah James Harrelson   DF:  Joseph Allen Nitchals appeared from jail. Case called at 3:34 p.m. Court notes this matter is set for a plea and sentencing hearing. ADA Ellenwood recites agreement.   Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads GUILTY to Ct 1 Possess w/Intent-Amphetamine in 22CF69. DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 1 Possess w/Intent-Amphetamine in 22CF69. On motion of the State without objection, Crt dismisses Ct's 2, 3 & 4 in 22CF69. Sentencing arguments. 20 days to appeal. Court adjourned at 3:48 p.m. 

Crt orders:
In Ct. 1:
- Impose 1 yr 14 days IC. 2 yrs ES. Run concurrent to 07CF166. 108 days credit. 
- Court costs of $268.00. Reduce to a civil judgment. 
- DNA Sample and Surcharge of $250.00
- AODA and follow any recommended treatment.
- Absolute sobriety.  
- Eligible for CIP and SAP. 
- Random UA testing at the discretion of the Probation Agent.
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 23, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
Update from Health & Human Services re: Substance Abuse Treatment Program. FILE per RMW. hml

Final pre-trial on June 29, 2022 at 08:00 am.
Jury trial on July 13, 2022 at 08:00 am.

CO: RMW , REP: Melstrom, CLERK: Liddle ADA: Erica Ellenwood   DF ATTY:  Jeremiah James Harrelson   DF:  Joseph Allen Nitchals appeared from jail. Case called at 10:04 a.m. Court notes this matter is set for an arraignment. Atty Harrelson has received a copy of information. Has reviewed with client. Waives further reading. NG plea entered.  Reserves on jurisdictional objections. Speedy trial demand made. Few missing pieces of discovery but has followed up with the State. ADA Ellenwood states items have not been sent to the lab but will send out now. Court schedules for jury trial and final pre trial conference. All final pre trial submissions to be filed by 06/20/22. Atty Harrelson may need a motion hearing but needs to wait for additional discovery. Court notes the trial date is scheduled just outside the 90 days. Atty Harrelson reviews time lines with client. DE is in agreement. Court will file a scheduling order. Court adjourned at 10:40 a.m.  Jury trial scheduled for July 13, 2022 at 08:00 am.  Final pre-trial scheduled for June 29, 2022 at 08:00 am.
Arraignment on April 1, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Per bond signed by DE.  gll
Preliminary hearing on February 17, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia. Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive. All costs associated with testing shall be the responsibility of the defendant.

I understand that I must report to and comply with all terms, conditions, and protocols of the St. Croix County Justice Support Center. I further understand that I am required to submit to random drug testing and ETG testing at least ONE time per week. Failure to report and/or comply with conditions and/or protocols may result in a report to the District Attorney's Office, an arrest warrant, and/or referral for criminal charges.

I understand that I must report to the Justice Support Center immediately. If after regular business hours I must call (715)245-4109 to schedule an appointment with the Justice Support Center by the end of the following business day.

It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Andre Doby or Rachel Slabey.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, social media including but not limited to texting, Facebook, Twitter, contact through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

If the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bail jumping.
